thread.title: 84 Lumber courts controversy with Super Bowl ad - MarketWatch
thread.title_full: 84 Lumber courts controversy with Super Bowl ad - MarketWatch

author: Mike Murphy
title: 84 Lumber courts controversy with Super Bowl ad - MarketWatch
text:
84 Lumber appeared to win the title of most controversial Super Bowl commercial Sunday, with its ad featuring a young mother and daughter making a grueling trek across Mexico in search of a better life.
The pair are seen traveling by foot, truck and train across cities, rivers and deserts, and the girl picks up scraps of fabric amid the trash along the way. The ad ends before they reach their final destination, and asks viewers to go to the company‚Äôs website to see the conclusion of the journey that was too controversial for TV.
Super Bowl Ad: 84 Lumber (1:33) A mother and daughter take a journey in this Super Bowl ad for 84 Lumber.
It was, in fact, too hot for TV. CBS rejected the original commercial from the construction-materials company as too political. In the extended video online, the pair end their journey against a massive border wall. The girl unfolds the scraps she‚Äôs collected, which turn out to be a hand-weaved American flag. The pair then find an enormous door in the wall, which opens up and they enter their new country. ‚ÄúThe will to succeed is always welcome here,‚Äù the ad says.
Many never saw Part 2 of the commercial ‚Äî 84 Lumber‚Äôs website crashed, apparently from overuse, immediately after the ad aired.
Some on social media were quick to denounce the commercial as promoting illegal immigration and called for a boycott of the Pennsylvania-based company.
Glad to see 84 lumber encouraging illegals to break our laws & sneak into our country. Forgot to include the cartel smugglers tho. #Deport
‚Äî Jeremy Nolt (@RealJeremyNolt) February 6, 2017 The 84 lumber add is just propaganda for "legal" immigration and for border walls, it's stupid and regressive
‚Äî Guacboi (@Beckhambinho) February 6, 2017 I won't be shopping at 84 Lumber again. Too bad. Was great place. Adios. #SuperBowl #84Lumber
‚Äî Thomas Paine (@Thomas1774Paine) February 6, 2017 Others interpreted the commercial as merely showing people striving for a better life.
84 lumber company just reminded all of us. Who we all... really are. And how we ALL got here #84lumber
‚Äî Carlos Espinoza üá∫üá∏ (@Espinoza91C) February 6, 2017 To anyone who missed the point of the 84 Lumber commercial, it was simple and uncontroversial.
Illegal immigrants are humans.
That's it.
‚Äî #NeverTrump #Ex-GOP (@Trump_Truther) February 6, 2017 84 Lumber had the gutsiest commercial ever! Portraying the story of millions who just come to succeed. #welldone #84lumber üëèüèΩüôèüèº
‚Äî Rogelio Meza Jr. (@RogelioMezaJr) February 6, 2017 84 Lumber said the ad was intended to coincide with a national hiring campaign.
Last week, Michael Brunner, the CEO of ad agency Brunner, which created the commercial, told Business Insider last week that the spot reflected what 84 Lumber stands for: ‚ÄúA company looking for people with grit, determination and heart, no matter who they are, where they come from, or what they look like.‚Äù
